#summary Snippet - php code for your site

----
=Snippets=
_*What are they?*_
----
Snippets are pieces of PHP code that you create in the manager and use in your documents or templates. Snippets return content like a function.

The etomite class is also passed to snippets so you can use the api or use config variables, for example.

*Example*

{{{
<?php

$html = "Hello World";

return $html;

}

?>
}}}

_Notice the *return $html;*_

Snippets can be simple or complex and can call other snippets to run other code. You can also use chunks in the output of your snippet.

*Example*

{{{
<?php

$html = "This is a {{form}} that will output the form html code is in the chunk named form";

return $html;

?>
}}}

*Example with an etomite class call*

{{{
<?php

$docId = $etomite->documentIdentifier;

$html = "<p>This document ID is: ".$docId."</p>";

return $html;

?>
}}}
